info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 4:21PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clackamas, southwestern Multnomah and southeastern Washington Counties through 500 PM PDT... At 421 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Metzger, or south of Portland Downtown, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oregon City, Portland Downtown, Portland, Gresham, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, West Linn, Milwaukie, Wilsonville, Gladstone, Maywood Park, Rivergrove, Oatfield, Powellhurst-Centennial, Garden Home-Whitford, Hazelwood, Metzger and West Slope. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 285 and 301. Interstate 205 between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 84 between mile markers 1 and 10. U.S. Highway 26 west of Portland between mile markers 72 and 73. U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
